title: ‘We should stop talking October’: Alex Cora doesn’t want Red Sox to start thinking about playoffs yet
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora urges focus on current games, avoiding playoff speculation despite team's strong position.
Boston holds the second AL wild-card spot, trailing Yankees and Blue Jays, while Rangers close gap behind them.
Analysts give Red Sox over 90% postseason chance, despite tougher schedule and lineup challenges against lefty pitchers.

title: Red Sox CBO Craig Breslow reportedly prioritizing finding a GM this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Craig Breslow, Red Sox CBO, seeks to hire a general manager to serve as second-in-command this offseason.
The Red Sox have had no general manager since Breslow took over in 2024, with previous GMs serving under Dave Dombrowski and Chaim Bloom.
Potential internal candidates for the GM role include assistant general managers Raquel Ferreira, Eddie Romero, Michael Groopman, Taylor Smith, and Paul Toboni.

title: Patriots move on from Ja’Lynn Polk, reportedly trading him to Saints
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots traded wide receiver Ja'Lynn Polk to the New Orleans Saints for a 2027 sixth-round pick.
Polk was a second-round pick in 2024 and had 12 catches for 87 yards and two touchdowns last season.
The trade includes the Patriots sending a 2028 seventh-round selection to the Saints.

title: 5 things to know about Dolphins before Patriots take them on in Week 2
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Tua Tagovailoa has defeated the Patriots in all seven of his starts since joining the Dolphins in 2020.
The Dolphins suffered a blowout loss to the Colts, leading to a players-only meeting to address internal morale.
Dolphins' Tyreek Hill has struggled with big play production, not achieving a 30-yard catch since 2024 Week 1.

title: Review & setlist: Ethel Cain haunts Roadrunner with Southern Gothic epic
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Ethel Cain performed at Roadrunner, Boston, delivering a Southern Gothic-inspired concert on September 12, 2025.
The concert featured songs from her albums, highlighting a narrative of tragedy and Southern Gothic themes.
Cain's stage presence was immersive, blending emotional storytelling with atmospheric music and dramatic visuals.

title: 45 years later, Andover High’s Chiklis returns to gridiron for ‘The Senior’
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Michael Chiklis stars in 'The Senior,' portraying Mike Flynt's true story of reclaiming college football eligibility at 59.
Chiklis, an Andover High alumnus, faced physical challenges returning to football after 40 years for the film.
The film, directed by Rod Lurie, will have a national theatrical release on September 19 following a Boston screening.

title: Here are the Mass. residents who made the new Forbes list of 400 richest Americans
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Nine Massachusetts residents are included in Forbes' list of the 400 richest Americans.
Abigail Johnson is the richest in Massachusetts with a net worth of $35 billion, ranking 27th nationally.
Patriots owner Robert Kraft is the 78th richest American with a net worth of $13.8 billion.

title: In most anticipated series at Fenway in years, Red Sox faceplant against Yankees in opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox struggled offensively, producing only two hits and losing 4-1 to the Yankees at Fenway Park.
Boston's defense faltered with three errors, including a costly catcher interference by Carlos Narvaez.
Both teams are playoff contenders, Yankees with 99.3% and Red Sox with 95.4% postseason chances per FanGraphs.

title: Former Patriots DE Deatrich Wise Jr. suffers season-ending injury
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Deatrich Wise Jr. suffered a season-ending left quad injury during Thursday Night Football against the Green Bay Packers.
Wise, 31, was injured while attempting to block an extra point and will require surgery, according to ESPN.
Wise joined the Washington Commanders on a one-year, $3.25 million contract after eight years with the Patriots.

title: When will Connelly Early pitch next for Red Sox? Alex Cora explains
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Connelly Early could start next week against the Athletics at Fenway Park, following his impressive MLB debut.
Alex Cora plans to decide on Early's rotation schedule after talks with Craig Breslow by Sunday.
The Red Sox are considering using Early alongside other young pitchers Payton Tolle and Kyle Harrison.
